tool.name: MeasureObjectSizeShape
tool.description: measures several area and shape features of identified objects

configfiles.configfile:
import json import sys import os
FOURSPACES=@SPACES@
input_json_path = sys.argv[1] input_pipeline= sys.argv[2]
params = json.load(open(input_json_path, "r"))
def writemoss(): _str = "\nMeasureObjectSizeShape:[module_num:%d|svn_version:\\'Unknown\\'|variable_revision_number:1|show_window:False|notes:\\x5B\\x5D|batch_state:array(\\x5B\\x5D, dtype=uint8)|enabled:True|wants_pause:False]\n" % new_count
for obj in params['rpt_object']: _str += FOURSPACES + "Select objects to measure:%s\n" % obj['objects_to_measure']
_str += FOURSPACES + "Calculate the Zernike features?:%s\n" % params['zernike_feature']
return _str
with open(input_pipeline) as fin: lines = fin.readlines()
k, v = lines[4].strip().split(':')
module_count = int(v) new_count = module_count + 1 lines[4] = k + ":%d\n" % new_count with open("output", "w") as f: f.writelines(lines) f.write(writemoss())
f.close()
